resolutions.title: Learn to cook proper meals
resolutions.description: My roommate cooks these amazing meals and I'm tired of eating frozen pizza while she has actual food. Plus cooking looks kind of fun? Want to learn.

resolutions.title: Save €200 every month
resolutions.description: Grand so I've been absolutely useless with money lately. Need to cop on and start putting something away. Want to have a decent bit saved for a trip next winter.

resolutions.title: Cycle to work every day
resolutions.description: 8 km to work and I still drive like an idiot. Everyone here cycles, its embarrassing that I don't. Keep telling myself I'll start when its warmer but that's just... its always something isn't it. No more excuses this time. Probably.

resolutions.title: Practice Dutch every day
resolutions.description: I have lived here for 2 years but my Dutch is still very basic. Everyone speaks English so it is easy to be lazy. But I want to integrate properly and understand my colleagues better.

resolutions.title: Study English 30 minutes daily
resolutions.description: I want to improve my English skill for my work. My company will expand to overseas market and I need to communicate with foreign clients more confidently.

resolutions.title: No overtime on weekends
resolutions.description: Wife told me straight up she feels like a single parent sometimes. That hit hard. No more weekend work emails. Family comes first from now on.

resolutions.title: Clear AWS certification by March
resolutions.description: Boss keeps hinting about this cert. Honestly not even sure I want the onsite opportunity but the pay bump would be nice? Or maybe Im just scared of failing the exam. Been avoiding studying. Need to just do it and stop overthinking.

resolutions.title: Meditate 15 minutes daily
resolutions.description: Work stress has been getting to me lately. Everyone keeps recommending meditation but I never gave it proper try. This year I am making it non-negotiable part of my morning routine.

resolutions.title: Call parents twice a week
resolutions.description: I moved to Bangalore 3 years back and I feel guilty that I dont call home enough. Mummy keeps asking why I don't call. Twice a week minimum from now on.

resolutions.title: Quit smoking completely
resolutions.description: I smoke perhaps 5-6 cigarettes per day, more when stressed. My doctor says I must stop. This year I will finally be free of this habit that controls me.

resolutions.title: Read one book per month
resolutions.description: Je ne lis plus depuis des années. I want to rediscover the pleasure of reading. One book per month is reasonable, a mix of French literature and some English to practice.

resolutions.title: Actually play that piano
resolutions.description: Theres this piano at my parents place collecting dust and every time I see it I feel... something. Regret maybe? My sister took lessons and quit after 2 months. Don't want to be like that. But also what if I am. Whatever I'm just gonna try.

resolutions.title: Drink 2 liters water daily
resolutions.description: I drink too much coffee and not enough water. My skin is suffering and I often have headaches. A simple change but I think it will help my health a lot.

resolutions.title: Finish my side project app
resolutions.description: Two years on this stupid app and its still not done. Always finding reasons to tweak instead of ship. Perfectionism is just fear in disguise. Launching something this year no matter what.

resolutions.title: Run 5km without stopping
resolutions.description: Currently I can run maybe 2km before needing to walk. I want to build up slowly and by summer be able to run 5km continuously. Then maybe try a 10km race.

resolutions.title: Practice guitar 30 min daily
resolutions.description: Saw a video of someone playing guitar at a party and thought that looks cool. I have one sitting there. Why not actually learn? Would be nice to play at campfires.

resolutions.title: Meal prep every Sunday
resolutions.description: I waste too much money on buying lunch at work and the portions are usually unhealthy. If I prepare my meals on Sunday I will eat better and save money. Very practical.

resolutions.title: Hit the gym 4x a week
resolutions.description: Alright so I've let myself go a fair bit over the past couple years. Beer gut is getting out of control. Time to stop making excuses and actually get back in shape.

resolutions.title: Save $500 per month
resolutions.description: House prices are insane but I still want to save for a deposit eventually. $500 a month into a high interest savings account. No touching it for any reason.

resolutions.title: Quit energy drinks
resolutions.description: Doctor mentioned my heart rate was high at my last checkup. Didn't connect it to the energy drinks until she asked about caffeine. Kind of a wake up call honestly.

resolutions.title: Surf at least once a week
resolutions.description: Got a board sitting in the garage collecting dust. Used to go all the time but work took over. Living 20 mins from the beach and not surfing is criminal tbh.

resolutions.title: Volunteer once a month
resolutions.description: The animal shelter posted about needing weekend help and it actually sounds enjoyable. Dogs and cats? Sign me up. Plus I work from home and don't get out much.

resolutions.title: Ski at least 10 times this season
resolutions.description: Bought a season pass last year and only went 4 times. What a waste. This year I'm actually going to use it. Whistler is right there, no excuse.

resolutions.title: Walk the dog twice a day
resolutions.description: Poor buddy only gets one walk most days and he's getting chunky. Two walks a day, morning and evening, will be good for both of us I think.

resolutions.title: Ditch the drive thru
resolutions.description: Wife pointed out we've spent like  on fast food last month and honestly that's insane. That could be a nice dinner out instead of a bunch of sad drive thru bags.

resolutions.title: Read before bed instead of phone
resolutions.description: Screen time report said I averaged 4 hours a day on my phone last month. That's insane. Going to put the phone in another room after dinner and read actual books.

resolutions.title: Meditate 10 minutes every morning
resolutions.description: Anxiety has been rough lately. Doctor suggested meditation before medication. Worth a try I guess. Downloaded Headspace, let's see if it actually helps.

resolutions.title: Run a 10k by June
resolutions.description: Signed up for a charity run in June and now I actually have to train for it. Currently struggle with 3k so got some work to do. Following a couch to 10k program.

resolutions.title: Cook dinner 5 nights a week
resolutions.description: Ordering Uber Eats like 4 times a week and its killing my budget. $30-40 for dinner is crazy when I could make the same thing for $10. Time to adult properly.

resolutions.title: Do yoga 3x per week
resolutions.description: My back is always sore from sitting at a desk all day. Physio said yoga would help with flexibility and core strength. Theres a studio near my place, no excuses.

resolutions.title: Walk 10,000 steps every day
resolutions.description: Working from home has made me proper lazy. Some days I barely move from my desk. Need to get outside more and actually bloody walk like a normal human being.

resolutions.title: Quit smoking for good
resolutions.description: Tried patches, tried vaping, tried cold turkey. Nothing stuck. But I'm turning 40 this year and I refuse to be a smoker in my 40s. This is the year.

resolutions.title: Swim twice a week
resolutions.description: Theres a leisure centre 10 minutes from my flat that I've never been to. Swimming is meant to be brilliant for you and easy on the joints. Time to give it a proper go.

resolutions.title: Drink less beer
resolutions.description: Not giving it up completely but cutting back to weekends only. Having a few pints after work every day has become a bit of a habit and its showing on the scales.

resolutions.title: Declutter the flat
resolutions.description: My place is full of rubbish I don't need. Going to do one room per month until everything is sorted. Maybe even try that Marie Kondo thing everyones on about.

resolutions.title: Do strength training 2x week
resolutions.description: Always been a cardio person but Ive heard weights are important especially as you get older. Going to start with some basic dumbbell stuff at home.

resolutions.title: Stretch every morning
resolutions.description: Wake up stiff as a board most days. Just 10 minutes of stretching before work would probably make a massive difference. YouTube has loads of routines.

resolutions.title: Learn a new recipe every week
resolutions.description: Sick of making the same 5 meals. Going to try one new recipe every week, nothing too fancy just expanding the repertoire a bit. Might actually enjoy cooking.

resolutions.title: Quit vaping for good
resolutions.description: Switched from cigarettes to vaping 2 years ago thinkin it was healthier. Now I'm just addicted to this instead. Fixin to quit nicotine completely yall.

resolutions.title: Cut out fast food
resolutions.description: I eat way too much drive thru garbage. Its expensive and terrible for me. Gonna meal prep on Sundays and bring lunch to work.

resolutions.title: Save $500 every month
resolutions.description: Read something about compound interest and realized if I start now I could have real savings by 40. Kind of exciting actually? Like a future me project.

resolutions.title: Meditate every morning
resolutions.description: Therapist keeps recommending it for my anxiety. Figured new year is a good time to actually try it. Just 10 minutes before work.

resolutions.title: Run a 5k by March
resolutions.description: Signed up for a charity run in March. Currently can't run more than half a mile without dying. Following a couch to 5k program starting now.

resolutions.title: Journal before bed
resolutions.description: Mind races when I try to sleep. Heard writing stuff down helps get it out of your head. Worth a shot, cant hurt.

resolutions.title: Quit drinking soda
resolutions.description: Drinking like 3-4 cans of coke a day. That's insane amounts of sugar. Switching to sparkling water and maybe diet soda as a transition.

resolutions.title: Call mom every week
resolutions.description: She's getting older and I don't call enough. Always busy with work and life but thats not really an excuse. Sunday evening calls from now on.

resolutions.title: Walk 10k steps daily
resolutions.description: Work from home job means I barely move some days. Need to be more intentional about getting outside and moving my body.

resolutions.title: Pick up the guitar for real
resolutions.description: Bought a guitar 2 years ago and it sits in the corner. Actually going to commit to learning this year. 20 minutes practice a day minimum.

resolutions.title: No alcohol on weekdays
resolutions.description: Glass of wine every night has become two or three. Weekends are fine but weekdays I'm cutting it out completely.

resolutions.title: Stretch every morning
resolutions.description: My back and neck are always tight from sitting at a computer all day. Just 10 minutes of stretching when I wake up could help a lot.

resolutions.title: Meal prep every Sunday
resolutions.description: Always end up ordering delivery because I dont have food ready. If I prep on Sundays I have no excuse to order out during the week.

resolutions.title: Practice piano 30 min daily
resolutions.description: Had lessons as a kid, hated practicing, quit. Now I romanticize it of course. Bought a keyboard last year that just sits there judging me. This is probably a waste of time but also what if its not. Ugh just gonna start and see what happens.

resolutions.title: Drink more water
resolutions.description: Probably drink like 2 glasses of water a day max. Rest is coffee. Aiming for 8 glasses. Bought a big water bottle to help track.

resolutions.title: Break the Amazon habit
resolutions.description: Partner joked about how many Amazon boxes we get and I actually counted. 12 last month. That's wild. Want to be more intentional about what I bring into the house.

resolutions.title: Exercise 3x a week
resolutions.description: Doesnt matter what kind just need to move more. Could be gym, running, yoga, whatever. Just something 3 times a week minimum.

resolutions.title: Limit social media to 1 hour
resolutions.description: Screen time says I'm averaging 4 hours a day on social media. That's insane. Setting app limits and actually sticking to them this time.

resolutions.title: Floss every day
resolutions.description: Dentist yells at me every 6 months. Such a simple thing but I never do it. Making it part of my nighttime routine no excuses.

resolutions.title: Wake up at 6am
resolutions.description: Currently waking up at 7:30 and rushing to work. Want to have a calm morning routine with time for exercise and breakfast.

resolutions.title: Do yoga 3x a week
resolutions.description: Everyone says yoga helps with stress and flexibility. Never tried it properly. Going to follow YouTube videos at home to start.

resolutions.title: Eat vegetables every day
resolutions.description: My diet is basically carbs and protein. Probably havent eaten a vegetable in weeks. Need to add some greens to at least one meal daily.

resolutions.title: Pay off student loans faster
resolutions.description: Been paying minimum for years. Going to add an extra $200 a month and actually make a dent in this debt finally.

resolutions.title: Take vitamins daily
resolutions.description: Have a whole bottle of vitamins I bought months ago and never take. Just need to build the habit. Right after breakfast every day.

resolutions.title: Write in gratitude journal
resolutions.description: Therapist suggested writing 3 things I'm grateful for each day. Supposed to help with negative thinking patterns. Trying it for a month at least.

resolutions.title: Cook dinner 5 nights a week
resolutions.description: Ordering takeout way too much. Its expensive and unhealthy. Going to learn some simple recipes and actually use my kitchen.

resolutions.title: Kick the energy drink habit
resolutions.description: Drinking 2-3 Monsters a day and my heart races sometimes. Switching to coffee only. Still caffeine but less sketchy.

resolutions.title: Bike to work twice a week
resolutions.description: Live 4 miles from office. Its a nice ride but Im lazy about it. Committing to at least twice a week weather permitting.

resolutions.title: Learn photography
resolutions.description: Got a really nice camera as a gift and I want to actually do it justice. The auto mode photos are fine but I see what others do with similar cameras and it looks like a different world.

resolutions.title: Drink less coffee
resolutions.description: Currently at like 5-6 cups a day. Jittery all the time and sleep is bad. Cutting down to 2 cups max, morning only.

resolutions.title: Go to bed by 11pm
resolutions.description: Stay up way too late watching TV or on my phone. Then Im tired all day. Setting a hard bedtime like I'm a kid again.

resolutions.title: Strength train 3x a week
resolutions.description: Only ever done cardio. Time to actually lift some weights. Following a beginner program from Reddit fitness.

resolutions.title: Volunteer once a month
resolutions.description: Always say I want to give back but never do anything. Local food bank needs help on weekends. No more excuses.

resolutions.title: Take a real lunch break
resolutions.description: Always eat at my desk while working. Not healthy mentally or physically. Going to step away for at least 30 minutes every day.

resolutions.title: Spend less on coffee shops
resolutions.description: Dropping $6-7 on lattes every day adds up fast. Making coffee at home and treating myself to a cafe once a week max.

resolutions.title: Do skincare routine daily
resolutions.description: Keep buying products and then not using them. Just need to actually wash my face and moisturize every night. Basic stuff.

resolutions.title: Learn to code
resolutions.description: Everyones talking about AI and tech. Feel like I should understand the basics at least. Starting with Python tutorials.

resolutions.title: Declutter one room per month
resolutions.description: Place is full of stuff I never use. Going to do one room per month until everything is organized or donated.

resolutions.title: Swim laps twice a week
resolutions.description: Theres a pool at my gym I never use. Swimming is supposed to be great exercise and easy on joints. Time to actually try it.

resolutions.title: 5 minutes of breathing before work
resolutions.description: Always stressed and anxious. Going to try those breathing exercises and being more present. Sounds woo woo but worth a shot.

resolutions.title: Walk during lunch break
resolutions.description: Just sit at desk all day and its making me sluggish. Even a 15 minute walk outside would help clear my head.

resolutions.title: Budget and track spending
resolutions.description: No idea where my money goes each month. Going to use an app to track everything and make a real budget finally.

resolutions.title: Message one friend every week
resolutions.description: Bad at keeping in touch with people. Going to reach out to at least one friend every week just to check in.

resolutions.title: Quit smoking weed
resolutions.description: Been smoking every night for years. Its becoming a crutch. Taking a break at minimum, maybe quitting for good.

resolutions.title: Finish my side project
resolutions.description: Some guy in my twitter feed launched a simple app and it went viral. Made me think - why am I sitting on my idea? Worst case nobody uses it. Best case who knows.

resolutions.title: Network more professionally
resolutions.description: Bad at putting myself out there. Going to attend at least one industry event per month and actually talk to people.

resolutions.title: Start tasks within 5 minutes
resolutions.description: Always leave things to the last minute. Going to try the pomodoro technique and just start tasks instead of dreading them.

resolutions.title: Get 8 hours sleep
resolutions.description: Running on 5-6 hours most nights and its catching up to me. Making sleep a priority, not something that gets whatever time is left.

resolutions.title: Hike once a week
resolutions.description: Live near great trails and never use them. Weekend hikes would be good exercise and good for mental health. Starting easy and building up.

resolutions.title: Learn a new language
resolutions.description: Want to travel more and speak something besides English. Starting with Spanish since its practical in the US.

resolutions.title: Eat breakfast every day
resolutions.description: Usually skip it and then binge at lunch. Going to have something healthy every morning even if its just yogurt and fruit.

resolutions.title: Do 50 pushups a day
resolutions.description: Simple goal but I'm starting from basically zero. Just want to build some basic upper body strength. Can break it into sets throughout the day.

resolutions.title: No more nail biting
resolutions.description: Gross habit I've had since childhood. Finally want to stop. Going to try that bitter nail polish stuff and be more mindful.

resolutions.title: Practice drawing daily
resolutions.description: Always wanted to be able to draw but never put in the time. Going to do at least one sketch a day even if its bad. Improvement comes from practice.

resolutions.title: No more hitting snooze
resolutions.description: Waste so much time in the morning hitting snooze 10 times. When the alarm goes off I'm getting up. Period.

resolutions.title: Drink less alcohol
resolutions.description: Not quitting but cutting way back. Max 2 drinks on weekends only. Been overdoing it socially and its affecting everything.

resolutions.title: Invest $200 monthly
resolutions.description: Finally opened a brokerage account. Going to put $200 in every month into index funds. Long term thinking. Future me will thank me.

resolutions.title: Meditate before bed
resolutions.description: Mind races at night and can't sleep. Going to try 10 mins of meditation before bed to calm down. Worth a shot.

resolutions.title: Go to therapy
resolutions.description: Been telling myself I should go to therapy for like 3 years now. Always find a reason not to. Too expensive, too busy, not that bad, whatever. Its probably that bad. Just gonna make the appointment before I talk myself out of it again.

resolutions.title: Spend time outside daily
resolutions.description: Work from home means I can go days without going outside. That can't be healthy. Even 15 mins a day in fresh air.

resolutions.title: Read nonfiction books
resolutions.description: Usually just read fiction for fun. Want to learn stuff too. One nonfiction book a month about history or science or whatever.

resolutions.title: Clean apartment weekly
resolutions.description: Let things pile up and then do a massive clean every few weeks. Going to do a little bit every weekend instead. Easier to maintain.

resolutions.title: Stop cracking knuckles
resolutions.description: My coworkers hate it and so do I. Its just a nervous habit. Going to try keeping my hands busy with a stress ball instead.

resolutions.title: Do yoga twice a week
resolutions.description: Flexibility is terrible. Can barely touch my toes. Yoga seems like a gentle way to work on it. Following YouTube videos.

resolutions.title: Eat more protein
resolutions.description: Realizing my diet is mostly carbs. Going to aim for protein with every meal. Eggs chicken fish beans whatever.

resolutions.title: Take up running
resolutions.description: Never been a runner but want to try. Starting with walk/run intervals. No pressure to be fast just want to build the habit.

resolutions.title: Study for 2 hours daily
resolutions.description: Grad school is kicking my butt. Need to be more disciplined about studying instead of cramming. 2 focused hours every day.

resolutions.title: Stop ordering delivery
resolutions.description: Uber Eats is draining my bank account. $30-40 every time for one meal. Going to cook or at least pick up food myself.

resolutions.title: Exercise in the morning
resolutions.description: After work me is useless. Full of excuses. Tired, hungry, one more episode, blah blah. Morning me is stupid and half asleep but at least I can't argue with myself as much? Idk if this will work but evening workouts clearly don't so.

resolutions.title: Write 500 words daily
resolutions.description: Have had this novel idea in my head for years. Years. Never write. Always too tired or distracted or whatever excuse. 500 words is nothing really. Most of it will be garbage but that's fine I think? Just need to stop being precious about it.

resolutions.title: Do planks daily
resolutions.description: Core strength is nonexistent. Starting with 30 second planks and building up. Simple exercise I can do anywhere.

resolutions.title: One chess lesson per week
resolutions.description: Everyone seems to be into chess lately. Never learned properly as a kid. Going to study openings and tactics.

resolutions.title: Cut out sugar
resolutions.description: Eating way too much candy and dessert. Not going completely zero but cutting way back. Fruits for sweet cravings instead.

resolutions.title: Wake up same time daily
resolutions.description: Sleep schedule is all over the place. Going to wake up at 7am every day even weekends. Supposed to help sleep quality.

resolutions.title: Join a club or group
resolutions.description: Need to meet people outside of work. Going to join something - book club, running group, whatever. Get out of my comfort zone.

resolutions.title: 20 mins guitar practice daily
resolutions.description: Have a guitar collecting dust. Committing to 20 mins a day. Want to be able to play some songs by end of year.

resolutions.title: Kitchen closes at 8pm
resolutions.description: Late night snacking is out of control. Kitchen closes at 8pm. If I'm hungry Ill have water or tea. That's it.

resolutions.title: Text less drive more
resolutions.description: Bad habit of looking at phone while driving. Dangerous and stupid. Phone goes in backseat or glove box when I drive.

resolutions.title: Organize finances
resolutions.description: Have no idea where my money goes. Setting up a budget and tracking every expense. Time to adult properly.

resolutions.title: Walk 30 mins daily
resolutions.description: Simple and sustainable. Just a 30 minute walk every day. Can listen to podcasts. Easy way to stay active.

resolutions.title: Learn to cook 10 recipes
resolutions.description: Can barely make scrambled eggs. Want to learn 10 solid recipes I can rotate through. Watching YouTube cooking videos.

resolutions.title: Cold shower every morning
resolutions.description: Heard its good for energy and discipline. Starting with cold at the end of normal shower, building up to full cold.

resolutions.title: Limit Netflix to 1 hour
resolutions.description: Binge watching way too much. Whole evenings disappear. Setting a 1 hour limit then doing something else.

resolutions.title: Draw or write for 30 mins every Sunday
resolutions.description: Life is just work and chores. Want to make something each week. Drawing, writing, music, crafts, anything creative.

resolutions.title: Stretch after sitting
resolutions.description: Sit at desk all day and everything hurts. Going to do 5 min stretch break every hour. Set reminders on phone.

resolutions.title: Hit 10k steps daily
resolutions.description: Average like 3k steps currently which is embarrassing. Working up to 10k. Will take time but setting the goal.

resolutions.title: Complete one beginner tutorial monthly
resolutions.description: Life got stagnant. Going to learn something new each month. Could be anything. Keep growing.

resolutions.title: Catch and reframe 3 complaints daily
resolutions.description: Realize I complain a lot and its negative energy. Going to catch myself and reframe things more positively.

resolutions.title: Save $100 weekly
resolutions.description: Small but consistent. $100 every week into savings. Adds up to $5200 by end of year. Emergency fund building.

resolutions.title: DIY one project monthly
resolutions.description: Want to be more handy around the house. One DIY project each month. Starting small - fix that wobbly shelf.

resolutions.title: Eat more vegetables
resolutions.description: Diet is like 90% beige foods. Need more greens. Adding a vegetable to every dinner at minimum.

resolutions.title: Start a garden
resolutions.description: Have a balcony that could fit some pots. Want to grow herbs and maybe tomatoes. Never gardened before but seems therapeutic.

resolutions.title: Run 3x a week
resolutions.description: Want to get back into running shape. Three times a week, doesn't matter how far or fast. Just get out there.

resolutions.title: Podcast less scroll less
resolutions.description: Always have something in my ears or scrolling. Want more quiet time with my own thoughts. Scary but probably healthy.

resolutions.title: Make bed every morning
resolutions.description: Sounds dumb but I never make my bed. They say starting with one small win sets up your day. Trying it.

resolutions.title: Journal 3x a week
resolutions.description: Thoughts are always swirling. Writing them down is supposed to help. Doesn't need to be daily, starting with 3x.

resolutions.title: Gym twice a week
resolutions.description: Just need to go. Twice a week is manageable. Not trying to be a bodybuilder just want basic fitness.

resolutions.title: Learn sign language basics
resolutions.description: Have a deaf coworker and want to communicate better with her. Learning basic ASL through online courses.

resolutions.title: Reduce caffeine intake
resolutions.description: Drinking too much coffee and feeling jittery. Cutting back to 2 cups max before noon. No afternoon caffeine.

resolutions.title: Be on time
resolutions.description: Always running 5-10 minutes late for everything. Its disrespectful of other peoples time. Setting alarms and leaving earlier.

resolutions.title: Cut back on online shopping
resolutions.description: Amazon cart is always full. Buying stuff I dont need. New rule - wait 48 hours before buying anything nonessential.

resolutions.title: Exercise daily even if short
resolutions.description: Something is better than nothing. Even just 10 minutes counts. No zero days.

resolutions.title: Try one new thing monthly
resolutions.description: Life is too routine. Want to try something new each month. New restaurant, new hobby, new experience. Anything.

resolutions.title: Posture check every hour at desk
resolutions.description: Slouching constantly and back always hurts. Going to be more mindful of posture. Maybe get a standing desk.

resolutions.title: Meal plan Sundays
resolutions.description: Winging it leads to bad food choices. Going to plan the weeks meals every Sunday. Prep what I can.

resolutions.title: Call a friend weekly
resolutions.description: Everyone texts but never actually talks. Going to call at least one friend per week for a real conversation.

resolutions.title: Practice gratitude daily
resolutions.description: Think about what I'm grateful for every morning. Just mentally listing 3 things. Supposed to improve outlook on life.

journals.content: Only cooked once this week and it was just pasta with jar sauce. Rest of the week was takeaways and frozen stuff. Sweet as, at least I'm being honest about it eh. Heaps keen to try harder next week.

Right so I set up an automatic transfer for €50 every Friday. Grand sure it's not the full 200 yet but building up to it. Figure it's better to start small than not start at all. Bank app makes it fierce easy to track so that's the craic.

Cycled every work day this week. The weather was cold but dry so it was actually quite pleasant. Takes about 25 minutes which is almost the same as driving with traffic. I feel more awake when I arrive at office.
Practiced Dutch twice. That's it. Between work and social stuff for new years I just didnt make time. Lost my Duolingo streak which is annoying. Need to be more disciplined about this.

I studied English every day this week. I watch YouTube videos with subtitles and practice speaking with language exchange app. My vocabulary is improving but speaking still makes me nervous. I worry about making mistakes.

No work on Saturday or Sunday! This is first time in many months. My wife was very happy. We went to a shrine together for hatsumode and spent time with the children. It felt strange to not check email but good strange.
Completed 2 modules of AWS course. IAM section was confusing initially but I watched additional videos on YouTube and concepts are more clear now. Planning to complete EC2 and S3 modules next week.

Meditated 6 out of 7 days using Headspace app. Only missed one day because I overslept. Its harder than I thought to quiet the mind but I'm starting to notice I feel calmer in the mornings. Baby steps.

Called home on Tuesday and Saturday. Mummy was so happy she talked for almost one hour on Saturday haha. Told her about this resolution and she said she will remind me if I forget to call. Now I have accountability partner!

One week without cigarettes! I won't lie it was extremely difficult. Using nicotine patches and chewing gum like crazy. The craving after meals is the worst. But I keep thinking of my health and my family. I can do this.
Started reading LEtranger by Camus. I read it in school but wanted to revisit. About 50 pages in so far. Reading before bed instead of watching Netflix. My sleep is already better I think.

Did not touch the piano this week. I was busy with New Year celebrations and visiting family. I know it is an excuse but the week was truly hectic. Next week I will start properly when life returns to normal routine.

Drank 2 liters of water every day! I bought a big bottle that shows measurements and I keep it at my desk. Had to go to the toilet more often haha but my skin already feels less dry. Simple but effective.

Worked on the app for 5 hours total this week. Fixed a database bug that was bothering me for months and started implementing the new dashboard. Progress is progress even if slow. The code is messy but I will refactor later.

Ran 3 times this week following the program. Only managed about 2.5km each time before walking but thats expected at this stage. The program says to go slow and build up. My legs are quite sore but no injuries.
Guitar practice happened twice. Thats all. New year week was chaotic with visitors and parties. Not a good excuse but its the truth. Starting fresh this week with a proper schedule.

Did my first meal prep on Sunday! Made a big batch of chicken curry and rice, portioned into containers for the work week. It took about 2 hours but now I have lunch for 5 days. Already saved money by not buying lunch on Monday.
Went twice. Just twice. Monday was good but then got busy and kept pushing it off. Gym was heaps packed which didn't help my motivation. Reckon I need to stop making excuses mate.

Set up automatic transfer of $125 every Friday into high interest savings. First one went through yesterday. Reckon I found a better account with 5% interest too. Not touching this money for anything. Keen to get that house deposit sorted eventually.

No energy drinks! Switched to coffee in the morning and water rest of the arvo. First couple days had headaches probably from caffeine withdrawal but feeling heaps better now. Also saving money - those things are like $5 each, bloody expensive.

Didn't surf at all this week. Weather was bloody awful for most of it and then I just got lazy on the weekend. Board is still sitting in the garage collecting dust. Bit disappointed in myself tbh mate.

Didn't volunteer this week. I know I said once a month so technically I'm not behind yet but I also didn't contact the animal shelter like I planned. Keen to email them today and ask about orientation sessions. No worries, I'll get onto it.
Went to Whistler on Saturday! Conditions were amazing, fresh powder. Legs were absolutely cooked by the end but worth it. Already planning to go again next weekend. That's 1 down 9 to go.
Two walks every day with Charlie! Morning one is short like 15 mins just around the block. Evening one is longer, we go to the park. He's definitely got more energy and so do I. Win win situation.

No fast food all week! Came close on Thursday when I was exhausted after work but made a quick pasta instead. Surprisingly not as hard as I thought. Already feel less bloated and saved probably $50 this week alone.

Phone stays in the kitchen after 8pm now. Reading a book called Project Hail Mary by Andy Weir. Finished like 100 pages already which is more than I read all last month probably. Eyes feel less strained too.

Meditated every morning using Headspace. 10 minutes right after waking up before I check my phone. Some days my mind is racing and it feels useless, other days I actually feel calm after. Sticking with it to see if it helps long term.

Ran 3 times following the C25K program. Week 1 is run 60 seconds walk 90 seconds repeat. Sounds easy but Im pretty out of shape so it was a challenge. No injuries though and that's the main thing. June feels far away but also close.
Cooked maybe twice this week. Ordered Uber Eats three times which is bad. The holidays threw off my routine and I kept saying tomorrow. Spent way too much money on delivery fees.

Made it to yoga 3 times! Tuesday Thursday and Saturday mornings. The instructor is really good at explaining poses for beginners. My back still hurts but I can already touch my toes a bit easier. Progress.

Rubbish week honestly. Only hit 10k steps twice. Weather has been absolutely miserable and I used it as an excuse to stay in. Proper knackered from work too which didn't help. Buying a decent waterproof jacket this week.
7 days smoke free! Using patches and keeping busy. The cravings are bloody mental but I'm managing. Whenever I want a cigarette I go for a walk or have a cuppa instead. Cheers to one week down!

Swam twice! Wednesday and Saturday mornings before work. The pool was quieter than I expected mate. Did about 20 lengths each time. Shoulders are feeling it but in a good way. Brilliant start, going to try for 3 times next week.

Had drinks 4 nights this week. New years week was proper rough with all the social events. Hard to say no when everyone is celebrating. Absolutely knackered from it all. But Monday through Thursday this week I'm staying dry. Fresh start.

Started on the bedroom! Filled 3 bin bags with clothes I haven't worn in years. Took them to the charity shop. Already feels more spacious. Next week tackling the wardrobe properly. Marie Kondo would be proud.

Did strength training Tuesday and Thursday! Just basic stuff with dumbbells - bicep curls, shoulder press, squats. Following a YouTube video for beginners. Arms are killing me but in a good way. Can definitely feel it working.

Stretched every morning for about 10 minutes. Found a routine on YouTube. Hamstrings still tight as anything, not sure if I'm even doing it right tbh. But I guess consistency matters more than perfection? We'll see.

Made shakshuka for the first time! Saw it on Instagram and looked dead easy. Turned out brilliant actually. Also did a stir fry midweek. Cheers to proper home cooking! Ordering in is just so tempting when you're knackered after work though.

7 days no vape! NGL the first 3 days were brutal. Headaches irritability the whole deal. Chewing a lot of gum. My girlfriend hid all my vape stuff so I couldn't cheat. Cravings still there but getting easier.

Ok so I caved on Thursday. Long day at work and just drove through McDonalds without thinking. Force of habit. Rest of the week was good though. Did meal prep Sunday, made chicken and rice bowls for the week.
Set up automatic transfer of $125 every Friday to savings. First one went through. Also cancelled a subscription I wasn't using. Small start but gotta start somewhere. $500/month here I come.

Meditated every morning this week using Calm app. Some days my mind won't shut up and I feel like Im doing it wrong. Other days I actually feel relaxed after. Gonna stick with it and see if it helps long term.
Started the C25K program. Week 1 is run 1 min walk 90 seconds repeat. Did 3 sessions this week. Its harder than it sounds when you're out of shape lol. March feels far away but also not that far.

Journaled every night before bed! Just writing whatever is on my mind for 10 mins. Some nights its boring stuff some nights deeper thoughts. Definitely falling asleep faster when I get things out of my head.
Caved and had like 5 cokes this week. There we're sodas everywhere at new years parties and I just kept grabbing them without thinking. The habit is more automatic than I realized. Ugh.

Called mom on Sunday and we talked for like an hour. She was so happy. Told her about my resolutions and she said she's proud of me. Set a weekly reminder so I don't forget. Its such a small thing that means so much to her.
3 out of 7 days hitting 10k steps. Work from home makes it hard, you don't even realize youve barely moved all day. Need to set reminders to take walks. Going to try walking meetings when possible.

Practiced guitar 6 out of 7 days! Following Justin Guitar on YouTube. Can almost play a full chord change from G to C now. Fingers hurt like crazy but apparently that's normal at first. Calluses coming.

No alcohol Monday through Thursday! Had wine on Friday and Saturday night but kept it to 2 glasses each. Actually enjoyed it more when its a treat rather than a daily habit. Sleep has been better too.
Stretched every morning for 10 mins using a YouTube video. My hamstrings are so tight its embarrassing. Already feel a tiny bit more flexible though. Back doesn't hurt as much when I sit at my desk.

Did my first meal prep on Sunday! Made a big batch of turkey chili and portioned it into containers. Had lunch ready all week. Saved prolly $50 in delivery fees and its healthier too. Kicking myself for not starting this sooner.
Practiced piano once. Just once. The keyboard is still set up but I keep walking past it. Need to figure out a consistent time to practice because winging it isn't working.
Drinking more water I guess. Got a big 32oz bottle and trying to refill it 3 times a day. Mostly just peeing constantly. Not sure I feel any different yet but everyone says it takes time so whatever.

Deleted the Amazon app! Had one moment of weakness where I almost redownloaded it but stopped myself. If I really need something I can use the website which is more friction. Saved probably $100 already.
Exercised once. Did one yoga video on Wednesday and thats it. Kept saying Id do it later and then it was bedtime. This is exactly the pattern I was trying to break. Frustrated with myself.
Ugh failed at this already. Still averaging like 3 hours on social media. I set limits but then just bypass them. Need a different strategy, maybe having someone else set my passcode for the limits?
Flossed every single night! Put the floss right next to my toothbrush so I see it. Takes like 2 minutes. Gums bled a lot at first but getting better. Dentist is gonna be shocked in 6 months lol.
Only woke up at 6am twice. The other days I hit snooze until 7. Need to put my alarm across the room. Hard during the dark winter mornings but I'm not giving up. Next week will be better.

Did yoga 3 times following Yoga with Adriene on YouTube. Shes great for beginners. Im not flexible at all and some poses are hard but she always offers modifications. Actually relaxing once you get into it.
Had vegetables with dinner every day! Mostly just steamed broccoli and salads but it counts. Bought some frozen veggie mixes to make it easier. Already feel less sluggish. Body probably in shock lol.
Made an extra $200 payment on my student loans. Set up automatic extra payments. Number barely moved tbh, these loans are crushing. But I guess every bit helps? Trying to stay positive about it.
Took vitamins every day! Put the bottle next to my coffee maker so I see it every morning. Just a multivitamin and vitamin D. Probably wont notice effects for a while but at least I'm consistent now.
Did the gratitude journal twice. Both times felt forced and I couldn't think of things. Not sure this is for me but gonna give it another week before quitting. Maybe I'm doing it wrong.
Cooked dinner 5 nights! Made pasta, stir fry, tacos, grilled chicken, and soup. Two nights had leftovers. Only ordered Uber Eats once and it was planned. Saved at least $60 compared to usual week.

Zero energy drinks! Switched to black coffee, 2 cups max in the morning. First few days had headaches from caffeine drop but feeling better now. Heart doesn't race anymore. Saving money too those things are expensive.
Biked to work Tuesday and Thursday! Weather was cold but manageable. Takes about 20 mins which is same as driving with traffic. Legs we're sore but good sore. Free exercise and saves on gas.

Watched some YouTube tutorials on photography basics. Learned about the exposure triangle finally. Took some practice shots around the house. Still on auto mode mostly but understanding why settings matter now.
Failed at this. Still drinking like 4 cups. The habit is so ingrained. Going to try switching to half caf first as a transition. Cold turkey clearly isn't working. Baby steps.
Stayed up past midnight most nights this week. NYE threw off my schedule and I never recovered. Kept saying just one more episode. Sleep schedule is totally wrecked now.

Hit the weights 3 times! Following the Reddit PPL program. Everything is sore lol. Starting with just the bar on some lifts to learn form. Ego check but better than injury. Already feel stronger somehow.
Didn't volunteer yet. Emailed the food bank but theyre doing orientation next weekend so technically Im on track. Felt like I should have done something this week tho. At least I made contact.

Took a real lunch break 4 out of 5 work days! Actually left my desk, went outside for a walk, ate without staring at a screen. Came back feeling refreshed. Productivity actually went UP not down. Who knew.
Only went to Starbucks once this week (Friday treat). Made coffee at home using a French press, actually tastes better imo. Spent like $7 vs my usual $40+. That's $140/month I can save. Wild.
Skincare routine happened maybe 3 times. Keep going to bed without remembering. The products are just sitting on my counter staring at me. Need to make it more automatic somehow.

Started a Python course on Codecademy. Done about 4 hours of lessons. Made a hello world program lol. Its actually kind of fun? Like solving puzzles. Long way from building anything real but gotta start somewhere.
Started decluttering the closet! Filled 2 garbage bags with clothes I haven't worn in 2+ years. Taking them to Goodwill tomorrow. Already feels more spacious. One area at a time, no rush.

Swam twice this week! Wednesday and Saturday mornings before work. The pool was pretty empty early. Did about 20 laps each time, mix of strokes. Shoulders sore but its a good workout. Might actually enjoy this.

Practiced mindfulness using the Headspace app, 10 mins a day. Mostly breathing exercises and body scans. Some days my mind wanders the whole time but apparently that's normal. Trying to stick with it.
Walked during lunch 4 days! Just 15-20 minutes around the block. Fresh air and movement in the middle of the day makes a big difference. Less of that 2pm slump. Simple but effective.

Set up YNAB to track spending. Entered all my accounts and categorized last months expenses. Honestly shocked at how much I spent on food delivery and random stuff. Knowledge is power I guess. Now to actually budget.

Texted 3 friends I havent talked to in a while! Just checking in, nothing major. Two responded right away and we had nice convos. One hasnt replied yet but that's ok. Felt good to reach out. Why do I not do this more.
One week without smoking! First few nights we're rough, sleep was weird, vivid dreams. But already feeling clearer headed in general. Saving money too. Taking it one day at a time.

Worked on the side project for 6 hours this week! Fixed a major bug and made progress on the UI. Actually feeling motivated for once. Set a goal to have a beta version by end of February. Accountability helps.
Found a local tech meetup happening next week and signed up. Nervous but that's the point right. Also connected with 2 people on LinkedIn. Baby steps toward being less of a hermit professionally.
Tried the pomodoro technique! 25 min work, 5 min break. Actually got so much done this week. The timer creates urgency. Not perfect at it yet but way better than my usual procrastination spiral.
Got 8 hours sleep 5 out of 7 nights! Setting a bedtime alarm helps. Two nights I stayed up late but that's still progress. Already feel more alert during the day. Sleep really is that important huh.
Did one hike this week on Saturday! Just an easy 3 mile loop near my house. Weather was nice. Forgot how good it feels to be in nature. Saw some deer. Already planning a longer one for next weekend.
Duolingo every day plus started Pimsleur audio lessons. The audio is better for actually speaking. Can introduce myself and count to 20. Tiny progress but progress nonetheless. Hola!
Had breakfast every day! Nothing fancy just yogurt with granola and fruit most days. A smoothie on Sunday. Actually feel more energized in the mornings and dont overeat at lunch anymore.
Only did pushups 3 days this week. Started strong on Monday then just forgot about it. Didn't even think about it most days which is the problem. Need to set reminders or something.
Havent bitten my nails all week! The bitter polish helps a lot. Catch myself bringing hand to mouth then taste it and stop. Nails are actually growing for once.
Drew twice this week. Kept putting it off because I didn't feel inspired. That's a dumb excuse I know - the whole point is to practice even when you don't feel like it. Gotta do better.
Hit snooze probably 4 out of 7 days. Ugh. The other 3 I got up immediately though which is progress. Need to put phone across room. Old habits.
Only drank on Saturday! Went to a party and had 2 beers. Thats it for the whole week. Honestly didn't miss it as much as I thought I would. Waking up without any hangover is nice.
Set up automatic $200 transfer on the first of each month into brokerage. First investment went into a total market index fund. Officially an investor now lol. Baby steps to wealth.
Meditated before bed 6 out of 7 nights. Using the Calm sleep stories. Mind still races but falling asleep faster. Also just feels like a nice wind down routine now.
Got outside every single day! Even if just for 15 mins walking around the block. Fresh air and sunshine (when there was any) really does help. Mood definitely better.
Started reading Sapiens! About 50 pages in. Its dense but fascinating. Learning about human history in ways school never taught. Going to take a while to finish but enjoying it.
Did a cleaning session on Sunday! Bathroom and kitchen done. Feels good to start fresh. Will do bedroom and living room next week. Small chunks way easier than marathon cleaning.
Caught myself cracking knuckles like 20 times this week. The stress ball helps when I remember to use it but half the time I crack before I even realize Im doing it. Ugh.
Did yoga twice this week! Found this channel called Breathe and Flow on youtube. The guy explains everything really well for beginners. Already can feel some improvement in how my back feels.
Protein goal was a mess this week. Most meals we're whatever was easiest - cereal, sandwiches, takeout. Didn't plan ahead at all. Need to actually buy protein sources and meal prep.
Went out for 3 run/walks this week! Following a beginner program. More walking than running tbh but thats fine. Just building the habit. Lungs burn but in a good way.
Studied for 2 hours 6 out of 7 days! Library is basically my second home at this point lol. Using pomodoro technique. Actual retention is SO much better than cramming the night before an exam.
Zero delivery orders yall! Cooked every meal or picked up in person. Saved atleast $70 in delivery fees alone. Food actually tasted better too. Deleted that Uber Eats app real quick.
Only worked out in the morning twice. Other days kept hitting snooze or just felt too tired. Evening workouts happened instead which is fine but defeats the purpose. Need better sleep.
Wrote 500+ words 5 out of 7 days! Mostly garbage but thats ok. The point is practice. Working on a short story idea. Might actually finish something for once.
Played chess on chess.com every day! Rating is terrible like 400 but slowly learning. Watching some YouTube videos on basic openings. The Italian Game is my friend now.
Had candy twice this week. Not as bad as usual but not sugar free either. The cravings are real. Eating fruit instead helps sometimes. Its a process.
Woke up at 7am every single day including weekends! Saturday was rough but I did it. Sleep schedule feels more consistent. Actually tired at night now which is good.
Found a running club that meets on Saturdays! Went to my first run. Was nervous but everyone was super nice and welcoming. Different paces so no pressure. Excited to go back.
Touched the guitar twice. Picked it up both times then put it down after 5 mins because my fingers hurt. I know that's part of it but its discouraging. Maybe I need better tutorials or something.
No eating after 8pm all week! Had to white knuckle through some cravings but did it. Herbal tea helps. Sleeping better too actually. Who knew late night snacking affected sleep.
Phone goes in glovebox every time I drive now! Habit is forming. Realized I used to glance at it constantly. So dangerous. Nothing is that urgent it can't wait.

Set up Mint and tracked all spending. The numbers are... bruhhh. $400 on food delivery last month?? deadass?? Creating actual budget categories now. This is embarassing but whatever knowledge is power i guess.
Walked 30 mins every day! Just around the neighborhood listening to podcasts. Easy and enjoyable. Already noticing I have more energy. Simple but effective.
Learned to make stir fry and fried rice this week! Both turned out edible which is a win. YouTube cooking tutorials are actually helpful. 2 recipes down 8 to go.
Cold shower every morning! Just last 30 seconds cold. Its brutal but I do feel more awake after. Apparently gets easier. Day 7 wasnt as shocking as day 1.
Only stuck to 1 hour twice. Other nights binge watched stuff. Its so easy to just keep going. Need to set an actual timer that turns TV off or something.
Made a collage from old magazines! Its not great art but it was fun and relaxing. Nice to make something with my hands instead of just consuming content.
Set hourly reminders to stretch. Actually followed them most of the time. Just basic neck rolls and shoulder stretches. Back feels less tense by end of day now.
Averaged about 6k steps. Better than my usual 3k but not 10k yet. Going to add a lunch walk to help get there. Progress not perfection right?
January skill is origami! Watched some tutorials and made a paper crane. Its actually pretty meditative. Going to learn more complex folds this month.
Caught myself complaining a few times and stopped. Reframed things more positively. Its hard to break negative patterns but awareness is the first step. Friends even noticed I seem more upbeat.
Saved $100 this week! Set up automatic transfer on Fridays. Barely notice its gone. Already $100 closer to my emergency fund goal. Compound consistency.
Fixed the wobbly shelf in the bathroom! Took 10 minutes and a screwdriver. Why did I let that annoy me for months? Feeling handy. Next up: that sticky door.
Had vegetables with dinner every night! Mostly broccoli and salads because easy. But hey it counts. Bought some frozen veggie mixes for variety. Body probably in shock lol.
Bought pots and soil and planted basil and mint! Theyre sitting on the balcony now. No idea if they'll survive but excited to try. YouTube has good beginner gardening tips.
Ran 3 times this week! We'll, run/walked. But I got out there. Using a C25K app. Slow progress but progress. Just need to keep showing up.
Had a few hours of quiet time this week. No podcasts, no scrolling, just my thoughts. Uncomfortable at first but kind of nice? Realized how rarely I'm not consuming something.
Made my bed like 3 times. Such a simple thing and I still couldn't do it consistently. Just walk right past it every morning rushing to start the day. This should be easy why is it hard.
Journaled 3 times this week! Just stream of consciousness stuff. Getting thoughts out of my head helps. Some entries are complaints, some are plans, some are random. All valid.
Hit the gym twice! Wednesday and Saturday. Just did some machines and light cardio. Place was packed but got my workouts in. Sore but good sore.
Learning ASL alphabet and basic greetings! Used Lifeprint.com which is free. My coworker was touched that Im learning. Signed hello to her on Friday. Long way to go but starting.
Had 3 cups most days instead of 2. One day had 4 because rough morning. Getting better but not there yet. The afternoon cup is the hardest to give up. Maybe switch to decaf?
Was on time for everything this week! Left 10 mins earlier than I thought I needed. Buffer time is key. People actually commented that I'm early now. Feels good to be reliable.
Only bought one thing on Amazon and I waited 48 hours first! Still wanted it after so I bought it. But passed on like 3 other things I wouldve impulse bought. System works.
Had 4 zero days this week. The no zero days thing is harder than it sounds when you're tired and busy. Even a 10 min walk felt like too much some nights. Need a lower bar.
Tried a new restaurant! Ethiopian food for the first time. It was amazing, ate with my hands using injera bread. Already planning what new thing to try next month.
Set up hourly posture reminders on my phone. Catching myself slouching and correcting. Also raised my monitor to eye level. Back already feels slightly better.
Meal planned on Sunday! Made a grocery list and stuck to it. Prepped some stuff in advance. Whole week I knew what I was eating. Less stress less waste less spending.
Called my college friend on Tuesday! Talked for like an hour catching up. Way better than texting. Why don't we do this more often? Already planning to call another friend next week.
Thought of 3 grateful things every morning! Coffee, my dog, having a warm bed. Simple stuff but it does shift my mindset. Starting the day positive instead of dreading things.

Finally made the call and booked an appointment. Took me like 3 days of staring at the number before I actually did it. First session is next week. Nervous but also kinda relieved I actually did something.
Did planks maybe twice this week. Forgot most days and when I remembered I just didnt feel like it. Need to set a reminder or something. Starting over next week.

posts.content: Anyone else finding it hard to stay motivated now that the NYE buzz has worn off? First of Jan was all excitement and big plans, now its just grey skies and back to work tomorrow. Trying to remind myself why I started.

posts.content: Small tip for fellow early risers - keep your alarm across the room so you must physically get up to switch it off. Once you are standing you are awake. Also splashing cold water on face immediately helps a lot. What are your morning tricks?
posts.title: alarm trick that actually works

posts.content: Gym was absolutely heaving this morning. Had to wait 15 mins for a squat rack. Part of me is annoyed but honestly good on everyone for giving it a crack. We were all new once.

posts.content: Just realised I havent touched my phone for 3 hours. Might not sound like much but for me that's massive. Been reading instead. Forgot how nice it is to just not be connected for a bit.

posts.content: I read somewhere that the third week is the hardest when quitting smoking. First week you have motivation, second week you have some progress, third week you only have the difficult feelings. Is this true for others here?
posts.title: is week 3 really the worst?

posts.content: Is anyone else doing meditation for the first time? I feel like I am doing it wrong. My mind never stops thinking. Maybe this is normal at the beginning?

posts.content: First day of the year. Wrote down my goals properly this time instead of just thinking about them vaguely. Not sure if itll make a difference but worth a shot I guess. Heres to 2026.

posts.content: Got up early and went for a surf before work. Best decision ever. The ocean was glass and I had it mostly to myself. If you're thinking about starting something similar just do it. Morning exercise hits different.

posts.content: First week of cooking instead of ordering in and its actually not as bad as I thought? The actual cooking takes like 30 mins, same time as waiting for delivery. Just needed to get over the mental barrier I guess.

posts.content: Day 4 without cigarettes and I'm climbing the walls. Please tell me this gets easier. Ive quit before and always failed around the 2 week mark. Determined to push through this time.

posts.content: To everyone who is struggling with their resolutions already - remember that one bad day does not erase all your progress. You can start again tomorrow. This is not all or nothing approach.

posts.content: My screen time is down 40% this week just from keeping phone in another room at night. Such a simple change but massive impact. Highly recommend if you struggle with late night scrolling.
posts.title: one simple trick cut my screen time 40%

posts.content: Started journaling this week and already finding it helpful. Just getting thoughts out of my head and onto paper makes them feel less overwhelming somehow. Anyone else journal?
posts.title: started journaling and wow

posts.content: Went to pub quiz last night and just had soft drinks. Mates we're confused at first but nobody actually cared. Realised a lot of my drinking was just habit rather than actually wanting a drink.

posts.content: Made shakshuka for the first time today. Looked up a recipe online and just went for it. Actually turned out pretty good? Feeling accomplished. What new recipes have you lot tried this week?

posts.content: Called my parents today and my mother was so happy she cried a little. Made me realise how much these small things matter to them. If you haven't called your family in a while maybe do it today?

posts.content: Daily walks are such an underrated form of exercise. 30 minutes listening to podcasts and I feel so much better. Simple effective free. Why complicate it?

posts.content: Making my bed every morning sounds dumb but it actually helps. Starting the day with one small win. Room looks better too. The little things add up.
posts.title: best budgeting app?

posts.content: honestly feeling pretty discouraged rn. already messed up my sugar goal multiple times this week. feel like everyone else here is doing great and im just failing. idk maybe resolutions arent for me
posts.title: step count competition anyone?

posts.content: Work has been so insane this week I literally haven't had time for ANY of my resolutions. Was supposed to clean every weekend but ended up working saturday AND sunday. Is it even worth trying anymore if work is just gonna keep taking over my life??
posts.title: how much water are you supposed to drink

replies.content: 100% feeling this. The excitement of a fresh start fades quick doesn't it. I've started writing down WHY I want to change in my notes app and read it when motivation dips. Sounds cheesy but it proper helps.
The beginning is always the most difficult, but also the most important. Un jour à la fois - one day at a time. We do not need to be perfect, only consistent.
Not cheesy at all, thats a great shout actually. Just wrote mine down. Thanks for the tip!
Mate the alarm across the room thing is genius. Gonna try that tomorrow. I keep hitting snooze like 5 times otherwise haha
Thank you for sharing this advice. I also prepare my clothes the night before so I do not need to think in the morning. It saves time and energy when I am still sleepy.
Yes! I do the same thing. Even gym clothes ready. Everything to reduce friction in the morning.
Haha same at my gym. Parking lot was insane. Give it 3 weeks and it'll thin out unfortunately. Good attitude about it though.
This is why I go at 6am. Very few people at that time. Maybe you could try going earlier or later to avoid the crowd?
6am is rough but you might be onto something mate. Might try it next week once the body clock adjusts. Reckon it's worth a shot.
I'm quitting vaping and its similar. The psychological habit is harder than the physical. We just gotta push through. You got this!
Week 3 was hard for me when I quit before but I also found week 1 the worst. Everyone is different. Just don't give up mate!
yeah that's normal don't worry. my brain still goes crazy most sessions lol. I just try to notice when im distracted and come back to breathing. some days are better than others
Totally normal. I thought I was doing it wrong for weeks. Apparently thinking your mind never stops IS the meditation lol. You're doing fine.
This is very helpful, thank you. I will try to be more patient with myself.
I'm learning Spanish too! Apps are good for vocab but I found talking to actual people helps way more for conversation. My wife quizzes me which helps even tho she laughs at my accent.
Both! Apps build vocab but you need real practice for speaking. Try changing your phone language to the target language, forces you to learn quickly.
Athletic Brewing makes great NA beer. Tastes like actual craft beer. Also Heineken 0.0 is surprisingly good. Game changer for cutting back.
Lagunitas IPNA is my go-to. Actually tastes like a real IPA. Also Partake Brewing if you're in Canada.
It gets easier I promise! I'm on week 1 with cigarettes too. First days are worst. Your body is healing even when it doesn't feel like it. Stay strong!

I successfully quit five years ago after numerous failed attempts. The strategy that ultimately proved effective was habit substitution - whenever I experienced a craving, I would perform ten push-ups instead. It may sound unconventional, but this approach addresses both the physical restlessness and the psychological need for ritual.
Cheers for the encouragement. We got this together!
Needed to hear this today. Had a rough day yesterday and felt like giving up. But you're right one bad day doesn't erase progress. Back at it today.

This is an important reminder. Progress is rarely linear - there will inevitably be fluctuations in motivation and performance. The critical factor is maintaining long-term commitment rather than abandoning one's goals after a setback.
Day 5 with cigarettes here too. Not gonna lie the cravings still suck but theyre less constant than day 1. Apparently week 2 is when it starts getting better. Hang in there
Definitely gets easier! I quit smoking 2 years ago. First week is brutal, second week is hard, third week onwards it slowly gets better. You got this.
Thanks man. Were in this together. Day 5 for you is goals. Keep it up
saaame lol new years crowd is crazy rn but hey at least ppl are trying right?? respect to everyone showing up tbh. it'll thin out in a few weeks but hopefully some of us actually stick w it haha
Keep alarm far away so you must get up to switch it off! Once you are standing you are awake. This trick changed my mornings completely.
Open the blinds immediately! Natural light signals your brain to wake up. Also don't look at phone first thing - the dread of emails makes you want to go back to sleep lol
I cycle to work in Netherlands and winter is definitely harder but you get used to it. Good waterproof jacket and gloves make big difference. Worth it though!
yooo same!! just started python and ngl hello world hitting different when it actually runs haha. we gonna be devs by end of year at this rate no cap
Python is great for beginners. Check out Automate the Boring Stuff, its free online and teaches practical stuff. You'll be automating tasks in no time.
Been there. First week is the hardest. Dreams get crazy vivid but it passes. Usually takes about 2 weeks for sleep to normalize. Hang in there.
Just discovered pomodoro too and its amazing. The timer creates urgency. Also the breaks are forced which is good for my workaholic tendencies.
Nice! I'm also doing C25K. Week 1 done. March race is gonna be here before we know it honestly
I failed day 1 lol. Alarm across room is the only thing that works for me. Also helps to have a reason to get up like exercise or nice breakfast.
Sleep earlier! Hard to wake up early when you went to bed at 1am. I set bedtime alarm now too. Sounds dumb but works.
Same! More walking than running at this point but we're out there. Thats what matters. Progress over perfection. We'll be running full miles by spring.
running groups r literally the best fr. accountability hits diff and its so much better than running solo. glad u found a good crew!!
Day 4 here. It does NOT feel easier yet lol. But I'm told it does eventually. The wake up effect is real though. Coffee who?
Wait I just replied to myself lol. Meant to say solidarity to anyone else doing cold showers!

I would recommend beginning with culinary herbs, as they tend to be quite resilient. Basil requires substantial direct sunlight. Mint is particularly hardy - though be cautious as it can become invasive if not contained. Water based on soil moisture rather than a fixed schedule.
Don't overwater! That's what kills most beginner plants. Stick your finger in soil, if it's dry then water. If damp, wait. Brilliant luck with your garden!
This is so thoughtful! Learning someones language shows real respect. I'm sure your coworker really appreciates it
Right?? Voice calls feel almost old fashioned now but they're so much better than texting. You can actually catch up properly. Going to call my mom tonight.
Congrats! Index funds are the way to go. Set it and forget it. Time in the market beats timing the market. Future you will definitely thank present you.
Totally agree! Walking is so underrated. Its free, low impact, can do it anywhere. I do the same thing
The Admiral McRaven thing! I started doing this too after watching that speech. One small win first thing sets the tone. My room looks better too lol
Ha yes the January gym crowd. But good on you for getting 4 sessions in week one. That is serious commitment. What program are you following?
PPL split - push pull legs. Found it on reddit actually. Heaps straightforward and hits everything twice a week.
7 days is one week! Big milestone. The headaches should stop soon. For me they lasted about 5 days then got much better
Meal prep is a game changer right? I started this week too. So much easier to eat healthy when the food is already made. Why didn't we start this sooner?
Gratitude journaling buddies! I'm doing this too. Some days its hard to think of stuff but that's when its most important right? Shifts the mindset.
One week! The vivid dreams are wild right? Means your brain is finally getting proper REM sleep again. It gets better, promise.
Pomodoro plus library is undefeated combo. Wish I knew this in undergrad. Better late than never. Good luck with your studies!
Running clubs are so great for accountability. Ive been thinking about joining one too. Might have to look for one in my area.
Cold showers are brutal but effective. Day 7 was definitely easier than day 1 for me. The mental toughness aspect is almost as good as the physical benefits.
thats really cool that you're learning for your coworker. i bet she appreciates it
Voice calls are underrated! I called my mom this week too after reading posts here. She was so happy. Why don't we do this more often?
The weather excuse is real! Got myself a good rain jacket and it helps a lot. Still not fun walking in rain but at least I'm dry.
Have you tried deleting the apps entirely? I know its extreme but it worked for me. Can still access on browser which is just enough friction to break the habit.
Actually nvm I see you're having same struggle as me lol. Were in this together I guess.
Mummy as accountability partner is so sweet! Indian parents love when we call them. Mine says the same thing - why don't you call more. Working on it!
Justin Guitar is great! G to C was hard for me too at first. Now its second nature. Fingers will stop hurting in a couple weeks
Yoga with Adriene is the best for beginners! She's so encouraging. I'm also super inflexible but that's exactly why we need yoga right?
Python buddy! Also doing Codecademy. Hello World gang. We gonna be building apps by end of year watch us.
Both of you check out the r/learnpython subreddit. Super helpful community for beginners. Also freeCodeCamp has good free resources.
Budgeting apps are eye opening right?? I was shocked at my food delivery spending too. Knowledge is power though. Now we can fix it.
Changing phone language is genius! Forced immersion. Might have to try that. Hola from another Spanish learner!
Chess gang! Also started learning this year. My rating is similarly rubbish but it's proper fun isn't it. Keep at it mate.
Yeah doing puzzles daily! My puzzle rating is way higher than my actual game rating lol. Tactics don't transfer to real games yet.
Balcony gardens are great mate! Basil and mint are perfect starters. Don't overwater and give them heaps of sun. You'll be eating fresh herbs in no time.
Being on time is such an underrated skill. People definitely notice and respect it. Buffer time is the key like you said. Good job!
Half caf is a good transition! Did that when cutting back. Eventually moved to decaf for afternoon cups. Baby steps work better than cold turkey sometimes.
C25K works! Did it a couple years ago. Follow the program even when you feel like you can do more. The rest days are important. Good luck with the charity run!
Meal prep Sundays are the best! What recipes are you making? Always looking for new ideas. The 2 hours investment saves so much time during the week.
I made chicken curry and rice this week. Also good are burrito bowls, stir fry, and pasta bake. Anything that reheats well basically.
One week smoke free is huge! The cravings get less intense over time. Week 2 was actually easier for me than week 1
Morning surf sounds amazing. I need to get back in the water too. Nothing clears the head like being in the ocean. Keep riding those waves!
Pushups as cigarette replacement is clever! Physical activity helps with cravings. Your arms will be huge by the time you're fully quit haha
Pomodoro changed my life too! The timer creates urgency that my brain apparently needs. Now I actually get stuff done instead of procrastinating for hours.
50 pushups a day is great! I'm doing planks. Bodyweight exercises are underrated. Simple but effective. Keep building that strength!
Writing 500 words a day is how books get written! Most of mine are garbage too lol but occasionally theres something decent
The food delivery spending shock is real! I had same reaction. YNAB is great for awareness. Now comes the hard part - actually sticking to the budget.
Run/walk totally counts! Thats how everyone starts. The important thing is showing up. Youll be running full miles before you know it.
Idk man sometimes one bad day does matter. I gave up on my resolution last yr after slipping once and never got back on track. not trying to be negative just being real
its always packed in jan then by feb everyones gone lol. see u guys in march... or not
lol wait til week 3 when the novelty wears off. thats when it gets hard. not trying to be a downer but just prepare yourself
pomodoro never worked for me. i just stare at teh timer waiting for it to end lmao. glad its working for u tho
cold showers are bro science imo but hey if it works for u then cool. tried it for a month last yr and literally just made me miserable
2 hours a day studying?? how do u even have time for that with work. jealous of ur schedule ngl
fair warning - learning to code takes WAY longer than ppl make it sound. im 6 months in and still feel like i know nothing. dont let tiktok devs fool u into thinking its easy
yall are wild with these cold showers. i tried it once and noped out immediately. props to anyone who can actually do this
walking is fine but if u actually want to lose weight u need to do more than that. 30 min walks wont burn many calories. just being honest
hey don't be too hard on urself. slipping isn't failing, quitting is failing. ur still here posting which means ur still trying. that's what matters
week 1 is hard for everyone. most ppl who look like they're doing great are probably struggling too and just not posting about it. keep going
cutting sugar is HARD. like one of the hardest things to quit. give yourself some grace. maybe start smaller? instead of no sugar try reducing by half first
ugh i feel this. work life balance is so hard. but also don't give up entirely just because of one bad week. life happens. try again next week
if work is consistently taking over ur weekends that might be a bigger problem than the resolutions tbh. might need to set boundaries with work first before other goals can happen
